revised_title: Supplement to a Former Paper on the Transit Instrument of the Cambridge Observatory
tldr: Robert Woodhouse, Plumian Professor of Astronomy at the University of Cambridge, provides a supplement to his previous paper on the transit instrument. He discusses a deviation in the instrument's plane due to differences in expansion in its braces and presents an instance where the pole star's inferior passage was delayed by 25 seconds due to sunlight shining on the upper western brace. This discovery has led him to question the accuracy of his previous solar transit observations.
